definitions.definition: Cunning; tending toward indirect dealings; crafty.
Performed with, or characterized by, art or skill.
Artificial; imitative.
Using or exhibiting much art, skill, or contrivance; dexterous; skillful.
An international distress signal used by shipping and aircraft

An infectious disease of humans and animals caused by a species of mycobacterium, usually Mycobacterium tuberculosis, mainly infecting the lungs where it causes tubercles characterized by the expectoration of mucus and sputum, fever, weight loss, and chest pain, and transmitted through inhalation or ingestion of bacteria.
Someone who sends spam.
A spring-loaded mechanical hammer specially adapted to be used in microgravity.
A mother of someone's parent.
A female ancestor or progenitor.
A girl or an unmarried young woman; maiden.
A female servant or cleaner (short for maidservant).
A virgin, now female but originally one of either gender.
An effeminate man, especially a homosexual.
A woman or girl employed to care for children
A type of round, flat bread baked in a tandoor popular in South and Central Asian cuisine.
The act of fulfilling the duties (of a given role, obligation etc.).
A legal decision that someone is not guilty with which they have been charged, or the formal dismissal of a charge by some other legal process.
Payment of a debt or other obligation; reparations, amends.
The act of releasing someone from debt or other obligation; acquittance.
Avoidance of danger; deliverance.
A military establishment for the storing, development, manufacturing, testing, or repairing of arms, ammunition, and other war materiel; an armoury.
A stock of weapons, especially all the weapons that a nation possesses.
A store or supply of anything.
Any supply of aid collected to prepare a person or army for hardship
definitions.example: He arrived with a large arsenal of cleansers and tools, and got right to work.

definitions.definition: Insolent boldness, especially when imprudent or unconventional.
definitions.example: Somebody never pays his loans, yet he has the audacity to ask the bank for money.

definitions.definition: Fearlessness, intrepidity or daring, especially with confident disregard for personal safety, conventional thought, or other restrictions.
A painter who paints in this style
Of, pertaining to, or in the style of expressionism
A heterosexual person, or other heterosexual organism.
Sexually attracted to members of the opposite sex.
Of, or using high technology.
Dangerously insecure or unstable; perilous.
Depending on the intention of another.
Relating to incipient caries.
An outdoor cinema where movies are projected onto a large screen and patrons watch from inside their vehicles, listening either by a speaker or a designated radio frequency.

A restaurant where patrons remain in their vehicles to consume their meals; the meal may be ordered and delivered to one's vehicle by a carhop waiter; or may require patrons to use a service counter. The cars in the parking lot serve as the patrons' dining room, there being a lack of dining rooms and tables.
definitions.example: The teenagers went down to the drive-in to order some hamburgers and fries.

definitions.definition: A drive-through restaurant where patrons remain in their vehicles and order food and beverages via a speaker phone; the meal is delivered by a service window accessible by car.
(of an establishment) Providing service to patrons who remain in their automobiles.
Relating to macroeconomics.

Relating to the entire economy, including the growth rate, money and credit, exchange rates, the total amount of goods and services produced, total income earned, the level of employment of productive resources, and the general behavior of prices.
Having a soothing effect; not irritating or stimulating.
definitions.example: a bland diet

definitions.definition: Lacking in taste, flavor, or vigor.
definitions.example: The coffee was bland.

definitions.definition: Lacking interest; boring; dull.
Mild; soft, gentle, balmy; smooth in manner; suave.
To mix; blend; mingle.
To connect; associate.
Mixture; union.
A summer beverage prepared from the whey of churned milk, common among the inhabitants of the Shetland Islands.
Lasting forever, or for an indefinitely long time
Set up to be in effect or have tenure for an unlimited duration
Continuing; uninterrupted
Flowering throughout the growing season
definitions.example: By means of artificial hybridization, practised for a series of years, he has succeeded in producing a race of carnations which are perpetual bloomers.

definitions.definition: A sudden, violent event.
A sudden and violent change in the earth's crust.
A great flood.
Any of several tropical fruits in the genus Annona:
A folding chair in which a wooden frame supports a length of canvas; traditionally used on the beach or onboard a liner.
A small passerine bird, the common linnet (Linaria cannabina, syn. Carduelis cannabina), in the finch family Fringillidae, native to Europe, western Asia, and north Africa.
A house finch (Haemorhous mexicanus), of North America.
A valued possession that has been passed down through the generations.
An old crop variety that has been passed down through generations of farmers by seed saving and cultivation, in contrast to modern cultivars used in large-scale agriculture.
Cold pre-cooked chicken meat in a creamy mayonnaise-based sauce with herbs and spices, used as a sandwich filling or in salads.
An expert of law or someone who researches jurisprudence.
A judge.
A type of double-pronged hairpin.
A rebirth or revival.
(historic) Alternative form of Renaissance
An adult male horse.
A very virile and sexually-inclined man or (rarely) woman.
A bar that is stressed to reduce roll (leaning to one side) in a car body during cornering.
A vegetarian whose diet excludes animal flesh, but accepts food that can be produced from a living animal without directly causing death (such as eggs, honey, and dairy products).
Contempt or disdain.
A display of disdain; a slight.
An object of disdain, contempt, or derision.
To feel or display contempt or disdain for something or somebody; to despise.
To reject, turn down.
definitions.example: He scorned her romantic advances.

definitions.definition: To refuse to do something, as beneath oneself.
definitions.example: She scorned to show weakness.

definitions.definition: To scoff, to express contempt.
A horse race, either across open country, or over an obstacle course
An athletics event in which the runners have to run 3000 metres round a track, jumping hurdles and a water obstacle along the way
To take part in a steeplechase event.
To wait as a server in a restaurant or other dine-in eatery.
That which flies, as a bird or insect.
A machine that flies.
An airplane pilot.
A person who travels by airplane.
A leaflet, often for advertising.
The part of a spinning machine that twists the thread as it takes it to and winds it on the bobbin
An arch that connects a flying buttress into the structure it supports.
(acrobatics, cheerleading, synchronized swimming) The person who is lifted and/or thrown by another person or persons.
A stray shot away from the group on a target.
A standard rectangular step of a staircase (as opposed to a winder).
A female kangaroo; a roo; a doe; a jill.
A leap or jump.
A risky investment or other venture.
To distribute flyers (leaflets).
To distribute flyers in (a location) or to (recipients).
To feed insufficiently, to cause malnutrition.
Suffering from malnutrition
On a small scale.
definitions.example: a small-time thief

definitions.definition: To expose to the weather, or show the effects of such exposure, or to withstand such effects.
(by extension) To sustain the trying effect of; to bear up against and overcome; to endure; to resist.
To break down, of rocks and other materials, under the effects of exposure to rain, sunlight, temperature, and air.
To pass to windward in a vessel, especially to beat 'round.
definitions.example: to weather a cape; to weather another ship

definitions.definition: To endure or survive an event or action without undue damage.
definitions.example: Joshua weathered a collision with a freighter near South Africa.

definitions.definition: To place (a hawk) unhooded in the open air.
Weather, especially favourable or fair weather.
Mechanical or chemical breaking down of rocks in situ by weather or other causes.
A slight inclination given to an approximately horizontal surface to enable it to throw off water.
A position as a lecturer.
A series of lectures, possibly by different lecturers, on a common theme.
Something that provides for lectures to be presented.
Unremitting heavy weight that does not move.
The largest weight of cargo a ship is able to carry; i.e, the weight of a ship when fully loaded minus its weight when empty.
Dead load.
That which is useless or excess; that which slows something down.
definitions.example: She wants to shed the dead weight of so many stacks of old clutter.

definitions.definition: (of a shot in snooker or other cue sports) With just enough weight for a ball to drop into a pocket, or come to rest in a precisely determined position.
definitions.example: He rolled the red in dead weight, and now he's nicely on the blue.

definitions.definition: The white root of a yellow-flowered plant, Brassica rapa, grown as a vegetable and as fodder for cattle.
The yellow root of a related plant, the swede or Brassica napus.
A large, heavy pocket watch, so called because its profile resembled the vegetable.
To plant with turnips.
To feed or graze (livestock) on turnips.
A voyager in cyberspace; a user of the Internet or virtual reality.
An earthquake that follows in the same vicinity as another, usually larger, earthquake (the "mainshock").
By extension, any result or consequence following a major event.
Emotional and physical distress following a traumatic event.
A hospital attendant given a variety of non-medical duties.
A soldier who carries out minor tasks for a superior officer.
Neat and tidy; possessing order.
definitions.example: He has always kept an orderly kitchen, with nothing out of place.

definitions.definition: Methodical or systematic.
definitions.example: We live in an orderly universe, where rules govern both the movements of planets and the binding of molecules.

definitions.definition: Peaceful; well-behaved.
definitions.example: An orderly gathering of citizens stood on the corner awaiting the bus.

definitions.definition: Being on duty; keeping order; conveying orders.
According to good order or practice; appropriately, in a well-behaved or orderly way.
In order; in a particular order or succession; with a suitable arrangement.
Wheat grains that have been steamed, dried and crushed; a staple of Middle Eastern cooking.
Resembling the metal copper, especially in color.

A thick, whitish cord of nerve tissue which is a major part of the vertebrate central nervous system. It extends from the brain stem down through the spine, with nerves branching off to various parts of the body.
A thin slice of fried potato eaten as a snack.
A baked dessert made with fruit and crumb topping
Anything baked or fried and eaten as a snack
definitions.example: kale crisps

definitions.definition: To make crisp.
definitions.example: to crisp bacon by frying it

definitions.definition: To become crisp.
definitions.example: to put celery into ice water to crisp

definitions.definition: To cause to curl or wrinkle (of the leaves or petals of plants, for example); to form into ringlets or tight curls (of hair).
To become curled.
To cause to undulate irregularly (of water); to cause to ripple.
To undulate or ripple.
To wrinkle, contort or tense (a part of one's body).
To become contorted or tensed (of a part of the body).
To interweave (of the branches of trees).
To make a sharp or harsh sound.
To colour (something with highlights); to add small amounts of colour to (something).
(of something seen or heard) Sharp, clearly defined.
definitions.example: This new television set has a very crisp image.

definitions.definition: Brittle; friable; in a condition to break with a short, sharp fracture.
definitions.example: The crisp snow crunched underfoot.

definitions.definition: Possessing a certain degree of firmness and freshness.
(of weather, air etc.) Dry and cold.
(of movement, action etc.) Quick and accurate.
(of talk, text, etc.) Brief and to the point.
definitions.example: An expert, given a certain query, will often come up with a crisp answer: “yes” or “no”.

definitions.definition: (of wine) having a refreshing amount of acidity; having less acidity than green wine, but more than a flabby one.
Lively; sparking; effervescing.
Curling in stiff curls or ringlets.
definitions.example: crisp hair

definitions.definition: Curled by the ripple of water.
Not using fuzzy logic; based on a binary distinction between true and false.
A pathological condition caused by painful masses of dilated veins in swollen anal tissue.
definitions.example: "I hope the worst is behind me". - France's midfielder Florent Malouds reveals he had an operation for haemorrhoids shortly after arriving in Germany for the World Cup" Argus 17 June 2006 p.14

definitions.definition: (often in the plural) An engorged, dilated and easily broken varicosity in the perianal area, often accompanied by intense itching and throbbing pain: piles.
A political philosophy that advocates traditional values.
A risk-averse attitude or approach.
A person who is not white.
Not white in color.
Not belonging to the white race.
Not associated with white people.
A mixture of different components.
A structural material that gains its strength from a combination of complementary materials.
A plant belonging to the family Asteraceae, syn. Compositae.
A function of a function.
(chiefly law enforcement) A drawing, photograph, etc. that combines several separate pictures or images.
To make a composite.
definitions.example: I composited an image using computer software.

definitions.definition: Made up of multiple components; compound or complex.
Being a mixture of Ionic and Corinthian styles.
Having factors other than itself and one; not prime and not one.
Belonging to the Asteraceae family (formerly known as Compositae), bearing involucrate heads of many small florets.
Employing multiple exposures on a single plate, so as to create an average view of something, such as faces in physiognomy.
definitions.example: composite portraiture; a composite photograph

definitions.definition: A (nonzero) natural number that is expressible as the product of two (or more) natural numbers other than itself and 1.
Having great vigour or energy
(of a task) Requiring great exertion; very laborious
Something serving as an expression of something else.
definitions.example: According to the Bible, the rainbow is a token of God's covenant with Noah.

definitions.definition: A keepsake.
definitions.example: Please accept this bustier as a token of our time together.

definitions.definition: A piece of stamped metal or plastic, etc., used as a substitute for money; a voucher that can be exchanged for goods or services.
definitions.example: A book token is the easiest option for a Christmas gift.

definitions.definition: (sometimes figurative) Evidence, proof; a confirming detail; physical trace, mark, footprint.
Support for a belief; grounds for an opinion.
An extraordinary event serving as evidence of supernatural power.
An object or disclosure to attest or authenticate the bearer or an instruction.
A seal guaranteeing the quality of an item.
Something given or shown as a symbol or guarantee of authority or right; a sign of authenticity, of power, good faith.
A tally.
A particular thing to which a concept applies.
An atomic piece of data, such as a word, for which a meaning may be inferred during parsing.
A conceptual object that can be possessed by a computer, process, etc. in order to regulate a turn-taking system such as a token ring network.
A meaningless placeholder used as a substitute for sensitive data.
(grammar) A lexeme; a basic, grammatically indivisible unit of a language such as a keyword, operator or identifier.
(corpus linguistics) A single example of a certain word in a text or corpus.
A characteristic sign of a disease or of a bodily disorder, a symptom; a sign of a bodily condition, recovery, or health.
A livid spot upon the body, indicating, or supposed to indicate, the approach of death.
Ten and a half quires, or, commonly, 250 sheets, of paper printed on both sides; also, in some cases, the same number of sheets printed on one side, or half the number printed on both sides.
A bit of leather having a peculiar mark designating a particular miner. Each hewer sends one of these with each corf or tub he has hewn.
A thin bed of coal indicating the existence of a thicker seam at no great distance.
A physical object used for exchange between drivers and signalmen on single track lines.
In a loom, a colored signal to show the weaver which shuttle to use.
(Church of Scotland) A piece of metal given beforehand to each person in the congregation who is permitted to partake of the Lord's Supper.
To betoken, indicate, portend, designate, denote
To betroth
To symbolize, instantiate
Done as an indication or a pledge; perfunctory, minimal or merely symbolic.
definitions.example: He made a token tap on the brake pedal at the stop sign.

definitions.definition: A minor attempt for appearance's sake, or to minimally comply with a requirement
definitions.example: he was hired as the company's token black person

definitions.definition: The act of keeping oneself in the background, as in humility.
definitions.example: John likes to remain unnoticed and does so naturally through the self-effacement found in his personality.

definitions.definition: A member of the Hindu priestly caste, one of the four varnas or social groups based on occupation in ancient Hindu society.
One who has realized or attempts to realize Brahman, i.e. God or supreme knowledge.
A scholar, teacher, priest, intellectual, researcher, scientist, knowledge-seeker, or knowledge worker.
A member of a social and cultural elite, especially in the New England region of the USA.
A learned person of refined taste and mild manners.
Under the influence of ecstasy (the drug MDMA).
Very much in love.
To move about in roving fashion looking for plunder.
definitions.example: a marauding band

definitions.definition: To go about aggressively or in a predatory manner.
To raid and pillage.
Raiding and pillaging.
Raiding and pillaging
definitions.example: a marauding band

definitions.definition: (of an animal) killing in wanton fashion.
definitions.example: A marauding stoat entered the rabbit warren and killed fifteen bunnies.

definitions.definition: (of an animal) killing domestic animals.
definitions.example: The marauding lion jumped the fence and killed the goat.

definitions.definition: A noticeable personal habit, a verbal or other (often, but not necessarily unconscious) habitual behavior peculiar to an individual.
Exaggerated or affected style in art, speech, or other behavior.

In literature, an ostentatious and unnatural style of the second half of the sixteenth century. In the contemporary criticism, described as a negation of the classicist equilibrium, pre-Baroque, and deforming expressiveness.
In fine art, a style that is inspired by previous models, aiming to reproduce subjects in an expressive language.

A highly skilled white/Caucasian challenger for leadership in a field whose top ranks are dominated by non-Caucasians; especially a field which was once dominated by white Caucasians, and is now dominated by those of black-African descent.
A person expected to succeed and bring prestige to their native group.
The landlord of a public house.
A tax collector in Ancient Rome.
Something that, or someone who, conceals.
A cosmetic designed to cover blemishes.
A medal made of, or having the colour of, gold, given as a prize for winning
(by extension) Finishing in first position, winning
Capable of being attributed.
definitions.example: His lack of conversation is attributable to his shyness.

definitions.definition: Allowed to be attributed.
The act of a character speaking to themselves so as to reveal their thoughts to the audience.
definitions.example: At the end of the second act the main villain gave a soliloquy detailing his plans to attack the protagonist.

definitions.definition: (authorship) A speech or written discourse in this form.
(very rare) To issue a soliloquy.
A building or a place where several activities occur in multiple units concurrently or different times.
(by extension) A large cinema complex comprising many (typically more than five, and often over ten) movie theatres or houses.
Throwing motion where more than one ball is thrown with one hand at the same time.
To interleave several activities.
To combine several signals into one.
To convert (a cinema business) into a large complex, or multiplex.
(juggling) To make a multiplex throw.
Comprising several interleaved parts.
Having petals lying in folds over each other.
Having multiple members with a particular condition.
A clearly defined path for pedestrians.
Unable or insufficient to produce effect.
Worthless.
Weak, indecisive; lacking forcefulness.
definitions.example: Our group leader proved highly ineffectual, caving to every whim put forth by the other members.

definitions.definition: A drug used to treat mild pain and fever.
A paracetamol tablet.
A structure of wood or stone extended into the sea to influence the current or tide, or to protect a harbor or beach.
A wharf or dock extending from the shore.
A part of a building that jets or projects beyond the rest, and overhangs the wall below.
To jut out; to project.
Made of jet, or like jet in color.
Able to be split
Easily split along a grain
Capable of undergoing nuclear fission, especially by collision with a thermal neutron
Any small insect of the order Diptera, specifically within the suborder Nematocera.
A flying insect of the order Lepidoptera, distinguished from moths by their diurnal activity and generally brighter colouring.
A use of surgical tape, cut into thin strips and placed across an open wound to hold it closed.
definitions.example: butterfly tape

definitions.definition: The butterfly stroke.
(in plural) A sensation of excited anxiety felt in the stomach.
definitions.example: I get terrible butterflies before an exam.

definitions.definition: Someone seen as being unserious and (originally) dressed gaudily; someone flighty and unreliable.
To cut (food) almost entirely in half and spread the halves apart, in a shape suggesting the wings of a butterfly.
definitions.example: Butterfly the chicken before you grill it.

definitions.definition: To cut strips of surgical tape or plasters into thin strips, and place across (a gaping wound) to close it.

The soft light in the sky seen before the rising and (especially) after the setting of the sun, occasioned by the illumination of the earth’s atmosphere by the direct rays of the sun and their reflection on the earth.
definitions.example: I could just make out her face in the twilight.

definitions.definition: The time when this light is visible; the period between daylight and darkness.
definitions.example: It was twilight by the time I got back home.

definitions.definition: The time when the sun is less than 18° below the horizon.
Any faint light through which something is seen; an in-between or fading condition.
definitions.example: The twilight of one's life

definitions.definition: To illuminate faintly.
Pertaining to or resembling twilight; faintly illuminated; obscure.
To broadcast, or be broadcast, by television
One who helps; an aide.
That which helps; anything serving to assist.
A person who does cleaning and cooking in a family home, or in a market; domestic employee.
A locomotive that assists a train, usually on steep gradients.
A hollow place in the earth; an abyss; a deep chasm or basin.
That which swallows; the gullet.
That which swallows irretrievably; a whirlpool; a sucking eddy.
A portion of an ocean or sea extending into the land; a partially landlocked sea
definitions.example: the Gulf of Mexico    the Persian Gulf

definitions.definition: A large deposit of ore in a lode.
A difference, especially a large difference, between groups.
(Oxbridge slang) The bottom part of a list of those awarded a degree, for those who have only just passed.
(Oxbridge slang) To award a degree to somebody who has only just passed sufficiently.
A sudden movement out of a straight line, for example to avoid a collision.
A deviation from duty or custom.
To stray; to wander; to rove.
To go out of a straight line; to deflect.
To wander from any line prescribed, or from a rule or duty; to depart from what is established by law, duty, custom, or the like; to deviate.
To bend; to incline.
To climb or move upward by winding or turning.
To turn aside or deviate to avoid impact.
Of a projectile, to travel in a curved line
To drive in the trajectory of another vehicle to stop it, to cut off.
The study of how the sounds of words are represented by spelling.
A method of teaching elementary reading based on the phonetic interpretation of normal spelling.
Phonetics.
Acoustics.
A piece or point of land, extending beyond the adjacent coast into a sea or lake; a promontory; a headland.
A sleeveless garment or part of a garment, hanging from the neck over the back, arms, and shoulders.
A superhero.
To incite or attract (a bull) to charge a certain direction, by waving a cape.
To head or point; to keep a course.
definitions.example: The ship capes southwest by south.

definitions.definition: To skin an animal, particularly a deer.
To defend or praise, especially that which is unworthy.
To look for, search after.
definitions.example: Long may they search ere that they find that they after cape.

definitions.definition: To gaze or stare.
definitions.example: The captain just caped mindlessly into the distance as his ship was hit by volley after volley.

definitions.definition: Bile, especially that of an animal; the greenish, profoundly bitter-tasting fluid found in bile ducts and gall bladders, structures associated with the liver.
The gall bladder.
Great misery or physical suffering, likened to the bitterest-tasting of substances.
A feeling of exasperation.
Impudence or brazenness; temerity, chutzpah.
A sore or open wound caused by chafing, which may become infected, as with a blister.
A sore on a horse caused by an ill-fitted or ill-adjusted saddle; a saddle sore.
A pit on a surface being cut caused by the friction between the two surfaces exceeding the bond of the material at a point.
To bother or trouble.
To harass, to harry, often with the intent to cause injury.
To chafe, to rub or subject to friction; to create a sore on the skin.
To exasperate.
To cause pitting on a surface being cut from the friction between the two surfaces exceeding the bond of the material at a point.
definitions.example: Improper cooling and a dull milling blade on titanium can gall the surface.

definitions.definition: To scoff; to jeer.
A blister or tumor-like growth found on the surface of plants, caused by burrowing of insect larvae into the living tissues, especially that of the common oak gall wasp Cynips quercusfolii.
A bump-like imperfection resembling a gall.
To impregnate with a decoction of gallnuts in dyeing.
A flexible sac that can expand and contract and that holds liquids or gases.
Specifically, the urinary bladder.
A hollow, inflatable organ of a plant.
The inflatable bag inside various balls used in sports, such as footballs and rugby balls.
A sealed plastic bag that contains wine and is usually packaged in a cask.
Anything inflated, empty, or unsound.
To swell out like a bladder with air; to inflate.
To store or put up in bladders.
definitions.example: bladdered lard

definitions.definition: A polyhedron with parallel ends of the same size and shape, the other faces being parallelogram-shaped sides.
A transparent block in the shape of a prism (typically with triangular ends), used to split or reflect light.
A crystal in which the faces are parallel to the vertical axis.
Of or pertaining to the practices and institutions that privilege or value heterosexuality, heterosexual relationships, and traditional gender roles as fundamental and "natural" within society.
definitions.example: Much of the language used when discussing wedding planning is heteronormative, which can alienate homosexual couples.

definitions.definition: The capacity to rely on one's own capabilities, and to manage one's own affairs; independence.
To discharge material (including waste products) from a cell, body or system.
The act of advancing, ; promotion to a higher place or dignity
definitions.example: the advancement of learning

definitions.definition: The state of being advanced
An advance of money or value; payment in advance.
Property given, usually by a parent to a child, in advance of a future distribution.
To change (or to be changed) from a solid state to a liquid state, usually by a gradual heat.
definitions.example: I melted butter to make a cake.

definitions.definition: To dissolve, disperse, vanish.
definitions.example: His troubles melted away.

definitions.definition: To soften, as by a warming or kindly influence; to relax; to render gentle or susceptible to mild influences; sometimes, in a bad sense, to take away the firmness of; to weaken.
To be discouraged.
To be emotionally softened or touched.
definitions.example: She melted when she saw the romantic message in the Valentine's Day card.

definitions.definition: To be very hot and sweat profusely.
definitions.example: I need shade! I'm melting!

definitions.definition: The process of changing the state of a substance from solid to liquid by heating it past its melting point.
The act of softening or mitigating.
Which is melting, dissolving or liquefying.
Given over to strong emotion; tender; aroused; emotional, tearful.
That causes one to melt with emotion; able to make others feel tender and emotional.
A second or subsequent evaluation or rating
